page.title: 19The Annual Fun Day
page.content: Every year we have a Fun Day in a field by the church at Coddington. This year a man from the local radio station called Marcher Sound opened the Fete. We started off with a fancy dress competition and I saw that one child was dressed as an ice cream lady, one was dressed as a dustbin and there was another girl with seed packets and pots of flowers sewn on her dress. After the competition we bought some things and had a go on some games. Later we heard the bells of Morris Dancers, who were dancing on the road and we went to see them. There were about ten men wearing clogs and with bells on their legs. At the other end of the field, men were shooting plates all afternoon and they call this Clay pigeon shooting.
